alert.note: Alert for Elmore (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Elmore County through 500 PM CDT... At 430 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Speed to Blue Ridge to near Tysonville. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wetumpka, Eclectic, Santuck, Titus, Weoka Mills, Emerald Mountain, Jordan Lake, Ten Cedar Estates, Blue Ridge, Dexter, Bob Woodruff Lake, Western Lake Martin, Claud, Central, Jordan Dam, Wallsboro and Ware. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
